com.schneide.quantity.unit
Class AtomarSignature

java.lang.Object
  com.schneide.quantity.unit.AtomarSignature
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AmountOfSubstanceSignature, CurrentSignature, DegreeCelsiusSignature, DegreeFahrenheitSignature, DimensionlessSignature, LuminousIntensitySignature, SievertSignature, SpaceSignature, TemperatureSignature, TimeSignature, WeightSignature
public abstract class AtomarSignature
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

The Signatur is the characteristic which desides, which Units can be converted to each other. If twoUnits have the same Signature they can can be converted.
For each Signature, you have to specify a referenceUnit. See getReferenceUnit().
The AtomatSignature is used in the class Unit.

Author:
Matthias Kempka, Anja Hauth

Method Detail

getReferenceUnit

public abstract AtomarUnit getReferenceUnit()
For all units with the same Signatur you have to declare the conversion faktor to get the declared unit in reference unit.

Returns:
the unit whisch is the reference for all units with same Signature

equalsSignature

public boolean equalsSignature(AtomarSignature atomarSignature)
checks if two atomar signatures represent the same signatures. This does not check exponent equality.

Parameters:
atomarSignature -
Returns:
true if the signatures are the same.
